text: Wriggle is an EP by American experimental hip hop group clipping. Released on June 14, 2016 through Sub Pop record label, it features appearances from artists such as Antwon and Cakes da Killa. For the track "Shooter", the band recorded themselves firing 15 different guns. The music video for the title track, which is based on a sample from British power electronics band Whitehouse’s "Wriggle Like a Fucking Eel", was directed by Rodney Ascher and released on June 29, 2016. ==Critical reception== Tiny Mix Tapes critic Frank Falisi wrote: "Nothing about Wriggle is especially venomous, given the noise of the band’s previous creations, as well as their explicit intentions." ==Track listing== # "Intro" – 0:51 # "Shooter" – 3:27 # "Back Up" (ft. Antwon & Signor Benedick the Moor) – 3:52 # "Wriggle" – 4:04 # "Hot Fuck No Love" (ft. Cakes da Killa & Maxi Wild) – 3:29 # "Our Time" (ft. Nailah Middleton) – 4:15 ==References== ==External links== * Category:2016 EPs Category:Clipping. albums Category:Sub Pop EPs
title: Wriggle (EP)
